param.name: appliance_hostname
param.doc: Host name of the appliance.

param.name: federation_id
param.doc: The system-assigned federation identifier.

method.name: POST
method.doc: To create a new partner, issue an HTTP POST command on the partners resource URI.
Note: For the change to take effect, it must be deployed as described in the Configuration changes commit process.

param.name: Content-Type: application/json
param.doc: Media type sent.

param.name: Authorization: Basic
param.doc: Basic authentication header.

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service.

param.name: name
param.doc: A meaningful name to identify this partner.

param.name: enabled
param.doc: Whether to enable the partner.

param.name: role
param.doc: The role this partner plays in its federation: "ip" for a SAML 2.0 identity provider partner, and "sp" for a SAML 2.0 service provider partner. Use "rp" for an OpenID Connect Relying Party partner.

param.name: templateName
param.doc: An identifier for the template on which to base this partner.

param.name: configuration
param.doc: The protocol-specific configuration data. The contents of this JSON object will be different for each protocol.

param.name: accessPolicy
param.doc: The access policy that should be applied during single sign-on.

param.name: artifactResolutionService
param.doc: Partner's endpoints where artifacts are exchanged for actual SAML messages. Required if artifact binding is enabled.

param.name: assertionConsumerService
param.doc: Partner's endpoints that receive SAML assertions.

param.name: assertionSettings
param.doc: The assertion settings.

param.name: attributeMapping
param.doc: The attribute mapping data.

param.name: encryptionSettings
param.doc: The encryption and decryption configurations for SAML messages.

param.name: identityMapping
param.doc: The identity mapping data.

param.name: extensionMapping
param.doc: The extension mapping data.

param.name: includeFedIdInAliasPartnerId
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to append federation ID to partner ID when mapping user aliases. The default value is false.

param.name: logoutRequestLifeTime
param.doc: A setting that specifies Logout request lifetime in number of seconds. If not provided, the default value is 120.

param.name: manageNameIDService
param.doc: Partner's endpoints that accept SAML name ID management requests or responses.

param.name: nameIDFormat
param.doc: The name identifier format configurations.

param.name: providerId
param.doc: A unique identifier that identifies the partner.

param.name: signatureSettings
param.doc: The signing and validation configurations for SAML messages and assertions.

param.name: singleLogoutService
param.doc: Partner's endpoints that accept SAML logout requests or responses.

param.name: soapSettings
param.doc: A setting that specifies the connection parameters for the SOAP endpoints.

param.name: anonymousUserName
param.doc: This is a one-time name identifier that allows a user to access a service through an anonymous identity. The user name entered here is one that the service provider will recognize as a one-time name identifier for a legitimate user in the local user registry. This feature allows users to access a resource on the service provider without having to establish a federated identity. This is useful in scenarios where the service provider does not need to know the identity of the user account but only needs to know that the identity provider has authenticated (and can vouch for) the user. Note: The user identity must exist as a valid user in the user registry.

param.name: artifactResolutionService
param.doc: Partner's endpoints where artifacts are exchanged for actual SAML messages. Required if artifact binding is enabled.

param.name: assertionSettings
param.doc: The assertion settings.

param.name: attributeMapping
param.doc: The attribute mapping data.

param.name: encryptionSettings
param.doc: The encryption and decryption configurations for SAML messages.

param.name: forceAuthnToFederate
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to force user to authenticate before linking the account.

param.name: identityMapping
param.doc: The identity mapping data.

param.name: extensionMapping
param.doc: The extension mapping data.

param.name: includeFedIdInAliasPartnerId
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to append federation ID to partner ID when mapping user aliases.

param.name: manageNameIDService
param.doc: Partner's endpoints that accept SAML name ID management requests or responses.

param.name: mapUnknownAlias
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to map non-linked persistent name ID to one-time username.

param.name: nameIDFormat
param.doc: The name identifier format configurations.

param.name: providerId
param.doc: A unique identifier that identifies the partner.

param.name: signatureSettings
param.doc: The signing and validation configurations for SAML messages and assertions.

param.name: singleLogoutService
param.doc: Partner's endpoints that accept SAML logout requests or responses.

param.name: singleSignOnService
param.doc: Partner's endpoints that accept SAML authentication requests.

param.name: soapSettings
param.doc: A setting that specifies the connection parameters for the SOAP endpoints.

param.name: defaultTargetURL
param.doc: Default URL where end-user will be redirected after the completion of single sign-on.

representation.name: ProtocolCreateData: OpenID Connect Relying Party partner

param.name: clientId
param.doc: The ID that identifies this client to the provider.

param.name: clientSecret
param.doc: The secret associated with the client ID. Set as "" if using a public client.

param.name: basicConfiguration
param.doc: The basic configuration data

param.name: signatureAlgorithm
param.doc: The signing algorithm to use. Supported values are "none", "HS256", "HS384", "HS512", "RS256", "RS384", "RS512", "ES256", "ES384", "ES512", "PS256", "PS384", "PS512". When algorithm selected requires certificate, such as "RS" or "ES" algorithms, either jwkEndpointUrl or both signingKeystore and signingKeyLabel must be specified. Default is "RS256".

param.name: verificationKeystore
param.doc: When signature algorithm requires a certificate, the keystore which contains the selected certificate to perform the signing. When signature algorithm does not require a certificate, this property is invalid. Cannot be specified if using a JWK URL.

param.name: verificationKeyLabel
param.doc: When signature algorithm requires a certificate, the alias of the public key in the selected keystore to use in signature verification. Cannot be specified if using a JWK URL.

param.name: jwkEndpointUrl
param.doc: When signature algorithm requires a certificate, the JWK endpoint of the provider. If a metadata endpoint is specified in BasicConfigurationData, the JWK URL will be read from metadata information. Cannot be specified if using a signingKeyLabel.

param.name: keyManagementAlgorithm
param.doc: The key management algorithm to use. Supported values are "none", "dir", "A128KW", "A192KW", "A256KW", "A128GCMKW", "A192GCMKW", "A256GCMKW", "ECDH-ES", "ECDH-ES+A128KW", "ECDH-ES+A192KW", "ECDH-ES+A256KW", "RSA1_5", "RSA-OAEP", "RSA-OAEP-256". When algorithm selected requires certificate, such as "RSA" or "ECDH" algorithms, both decryptionKeystore and decryptionKeyLabel must be specified. Default is "none".

param.name: contentEncryptionAlgorithm
param.doc: The content encryption algorithm to use. Supported values are "none", "A128CBC-HS256", "A192CBC-HS384", "A256CBC-HS512", "A128GCM", "A192GCM", "A256GCM". When key management algorithm selected is other than "none", the content encryption algorithm must not be "none". Default is "none".

param.name: decryptionKeystore
param.doc: When key management algorithm requires a certificate, the keystore which contains the selected certificate to perform JWT decryption. When key management algorithm does not require a certificate, this property is invalid.

param.name: decryptionKeyLabel
param.doc: When key management algorithm requires a certificate, the alias of the private key in the selected keystore to perform JWT decryption.

param.name: scope
param.doc: An array of strings that identify the scopes to request from the provider. Defaults to ["openid"].

param.name: performUserInfo
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to perform user info request automatically whenever possible.

param.name: tokenEndpointAuthMethod
param.doc: The token endpoint authentication method. Valid values are "client_secret_basic" and "client_secret_post".

param.name: attributeMapping
param.doc: The attribute mapping data.

param.name: identityMapping
param.doc: The identity mapping data.

param.name: advanceConfiguration
param.doc: The advance configuration data.

param.name: attributeTypes
param.doc: Specifies the types of attributes to include in the assertion. The default, an asterisk (*), includes all the attribute types that are specified in the identity mapping file.

param.name: endpoint
param.doc: The endpoint of the WS-Federation partner.

param.name: identityMapping
param.doc: The identity mapping data.

param.name: includeCertificateData
param.doc: Whether to include the BASE64 encoded certificate data with the signature. Defaults to true if not specified.

param.name: includeIssuerDetails
param.doc: Whether to include the issuer name and the certificate serial number with the signature. Defaults to false if not specified.

param.name: includePublicKey
param.doc: Whether to include the public key with the signature. Defaults to false if not specified.

param.name: includeSubjectKeyIdentifier
param.doc: Whether to include the X.509 subject key identifier with the signature. Defaults to false if not specified.

param.name: includeSubjectName
param.doc: Whether to include the subject name with the signature. Defaults to false if not specified.

param.name: maxRequestLifetime
param.doc: The amount of time that the request is valid (in milliseconds).

param.name: realm
param.doc: The realm of the WS-Federation partner.

param.name: signatureAlgorithm
param.doc: The signature algorithm to use for signing SAML assertions. Must be one of: "RSA-SHA1", "RSA-SHA256" or "RSA-SHA512". Only required if signSamlAssertion is set to true.

param.name: signingKeyIdentifier
param.doc: The certificate to use for signing the SAML assertions. Only required if signSamlAssertion is set to true.

param.name: signSamlAssertion
param.doc: Whether or not the assertion needs to be signed.

param.name: subjectConfirmationMethod
param.doc: The subject confirmation method. Must be one of: "No Subject Confirmation Method", "urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:cm:bearer", "urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:cm:holder-of-key" or "urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:cm:sender-vouches".

param.name: useInclusiveNamespaces
param.doc: Whether or not to use the InclusiveNamespaces construct. Defaults to true if not specified.

param.name: endpoint
param.doc: The endpoint of the WS-Federation partner.

param.name: identityMapping
param.doc: The identity mapping data.

param.name: keyAlias
param.doc: The keystore and certificate to use to validate the signature. Only required if verifySignatures is set to true and useKeyInfo is set to false.

param.name: keyInfo
param.doc: The regular expression used to find the X509 certificate for signature validation. Only required if verifySignatures is set to true and useKeyInfo is set to true.

param.name: maxRequestLifetime
param.doc: The amount of time that the request is valid (in milliseconds).

param.name: realm
param.doc: The realm of the WS-Federation partner.

param.name: useKeyInfo
param.doc: Whether to use the keyInfo of the XML signature to find the X509 certificate for signature validation (true) or the specified keyAlias (false). Only required if verifySignatures is set to true.

param.name: verifySignatures
param.doc: Whether to enable signature validation. Defaults to false if not specified.

param.name: wantMultipleAttributeStatements
param.doc: Whether to create multiple attribute statements in the Universal User.

param.name: assertionConsumerService
param.doc: Partner's endpoint that receives SAML assertions.

param.name: attributeTypes
param.doc: Specifies the types of attributes to include in the assertion. The default, an asterisk (*), includes all the attribute types that are specified in the identity mapping file.

param.name: identityMapping
param.doc: The identity mapping data.

param.name: providerId
param.doc: A unique identifier that identifies the partner.

param.name: signatureSettings
param.doc: The signing and validation configurations for SAML messages and assertions

param.name: subjectConfirmationMethod
param.doc: The subject confirmation method. Must be one of: "No Subject Confirmation Method", "urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:cm:bearer", "urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:cm:holder-of-key" or "urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:cm:sender-vouches".

param.name: useArtifactProfileForSSO
param.doc: Whether or not to use the artifact profile for SSO. Defaults to false if not specified.

param.name: artifactResolutionService
param.doc: Partner's endpoint where artifacts are exchanged for actual SAML messages.

param.name: identityMapping
param.doc: The identity mapping data.

param.doc: A unique identifier that identifies the partner.

param.name: maxRequestLifetime
param.doc: The amount of time that the request is valid (in milliseconds).

param.name: singleSignonService
param.doc: Partner's endpoint that accepts SAML authentication requests.

param.name: signatureSettings
param.doc: The signing and validation configurations for SAML messages and assertions.

param.name: soapSettings
param.doc: A setting that specifies the connection parameters for the SOAP endpoints.

param.name: wantMultipleAttributeStatements
param.doc: Whether to create multiple attribute statements in the Universal User.

param.name: accessPolicy
param.doc: The access policy that should be applied during single sign-on.

param.name: artifactLifeTime
param.doc: The number of seconds that an artifact is valid. The default value is 120. This setting is enabled only when HTTP artifact binding has been enabled.

param.name: assertionSettings
param.doc: The assertion settings.

param.name: artifactResolutionService
param.doc: Endpoints where artifacts are exchanged for actual SAML messages. Required if artifact binding is enabled.

param.name: attributeMapping
param.doc: The attribute mapping data.

param.name: companyName
param.doc: The name of the company that creates the identity provider or service provider.

param.name: encryptionSettings
param.doc: The encryption and decryption configurations for SAML messages.

param.name: identityMapping
param.doc: The identity mapping data.

param.name: extensionMapping
param.doc: The extension mapping data.

param.name: manageNameIDService
param.doc: Endpoints that accept SAML name ID management requests or responses.

param.name: messageValidTime
param.doc: The number of seconds that a message is valid. The default value is 300.

param.name: messageIssuerFormat
param.doc: The format of the issuer of SAML message. The default value is "urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:nameid-format:entity".

param.name: messageIssuerNameQualifier
param.doc: The name qualifier of the issuer of SAML messaged.

param.name: nameIDFormat
param.doc: The name identifier format configurations.

param.name: needConsentToFederate
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to ask user's consent before linking the account. The default value is true.

param.name: excludeSessionIndexInSingleLogoutRequest
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether the LogoutRequest messages sent out from this entity will exclude SessionIndex during IP init SLO flow. The default value is false.

param.name: pointOfContactUrl
param.doc: The endpoint URL of the point of contact server. The point of contact server is a reverse proxy server that is configured in front of the runtime listening interfaces. The format is "http[s]://hostname[:portnumber]/[junction]/sps".

param.name: providerId
param.doc: A unique identifier that identifies the provider to its partner provider. If not provided or an empty string is provided, the default value is "<point of contact URL>/<federation name>/saml20".

param.name: sessionTimeout
param.doc: The number of seconds that the SAML session remains valid. The default value is 7200.

param.name: signatureSettings
param.doc: The signing and validation configurations for SAML messages and assertions.

param.name: singleSignOnService
param.doc: Endpoints at an Identity Provider that accept SAML authentication requests.

param.name: singleLogoutService
param.doc: Endpoints that accept SAML logout requests or responses.

param.name: aliasServiceSettings
param.doc: The alias service settings to store the user alias.

param.name: artifactLifeTime
param.doc: The number of seconds that an artifact is valid. The default value is 120. This setting is enabled only when HTTP artifact binding has been enabled.

param.name: assertionConsumerService
param.doc: Endpoints at a Service Provider that receive SAML assertions.

param.name: artifactResolutionService
param.doc: Endpoints where artifacts are exchanged for actual SAML messages. Required if artifact binding is enabled.

param.name: attributeMapping
param.doc: The attribute mapping data.

param.name: companyName
param.doc: The name of the company that creates the identity provider or service provider.

param.name: encryptionSettings
param.doc: The encryption and decryption configurations for SAML messages.

param.name: identityMapping
param.doc: The identity mapping data.

param.doc: The extension mapping data.

param.name: manageNameIDService
param.doc: Endpoints that accept SAML name ID management requests or responses.

param.name: messageValidTime
param.doc: The number of seconds that a message is valid. The default value is 300.

param.name: messageIssuerFormat
param.doc: The format of the issuer of SAML message. The default value is "urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:nameid-format:entity".

param.name: messageIssuerNameQualifier
param.doc: The name qualifier of the issuer of SAML messaged.

param.name: nameIDFormat
param.doc: The name identifier format configurations.

param.name: pointOfContactUrl
param.doc: The endpoint URL of the point of contact server. The point of contact server is a reverse proxy server that is configured in front of the runtime listening interfaces. The format is "http[s]://hostname[:portnumber]/[junction]/sps".

param.name: providerId
param.doc: A unique identifier that identifies the provider to its partner provider. If not provided or an empty string is provided, the default value is "<point of contact URL>/<federation name>/saml20".

param.name: sessionTimeout
param.doc: The number of seconds that the SAML session remains valid. The default value is 7200.

param.name: signatureSettings
param.doc: The signing and validation configurations for SAML messages and assertions.

param.name: singleLogoutService
param.doc: Endpoints that accept SAML logout requests or responses.

param.name: aliasServiceSettings
param.doc: The alias service settings to store the user alias.

param.name: redirectUriPrefix
param.doc: The reverse proxy address to prepend to the redirect URI sent to the provider to communicate with this instance. An example is "https://www.reverse.proxy.com/mga". For the value "https://www.reverse.proxy.com/mga", the kickoff uri would be: "https://www.reverse.proxy.com/mga/sps/oidc/rp/<FEDERATION_NAME>/kickoff/<PARTNER_NAME>" and the redirect uri: "https://www.reverse.proxy.com/mga/sps/oidc/rp/<FEDERATION_NAME>/redirect/<PARTNER_NAME>"

param.name: responseTypes
param.doc: List of response types which determine the flow to be executed. Valid values to be included are "code", "token", "id_token". This selects the default flow to run when a metadata URL is specified in the partner configuration.

param.name: attributeMapping
param.doc: The attribute mapping data.

param.name: identityMapping
param.doc: The identity mapping data.

param.name: advanceConfiguration
param.doc: The advanced configuration data.

param.name: assertionSettings
param.doc: The assertion settings.

param.name: companyName
param.doc: The name of the company that creates the identity provider or service provider.

param.name: identityMapping
param.doc: The identity mapping data.

param.name: pointOfContactUrl
param.doc: The endpoint URL of the point of contact server. The point of contact server is a reverse proxy server that is configured in front of the runtime listening interfaces. The format is "http[s]://hostname[:portnumber]/[junction]/sps".

param.name: companyName
param.doc: The name of the company that creates the identity provider or service provider.

param.name: identityMapping
param.doc: The identity mapping data.

param.name: pointOfContactUrl
param.doc: The endpoint URL of the point of contact server. The point of contact server is a reverse proxy server that is configured in front of the runtime listening interfaces. The format is "http[s]://hostname[:portnumber]/[junction]/sps".

param.name: replayValidation
param.doc: Whether to enable one-time assertion use enforcement.

param.name: allowIBMProtocolExtension
param.doc: Setting that specifies whether the use of the IBM Protocol Extension is allowed or not. The extension allows a query-string parameter that specifies whether to use browser artifact or browser POST.

param.name: artifactLifeTime
param.doc: The number of seconds that an artifact is valid.

param.name: assertionSettings
param.doc: The assertion settings.

param.name: attributeTypes
param.doc: Specifies the types of attributes to include in the assertion. The default, an asterisk (*), includes all the attribute types that are specified in the identity mapping file.

param.name: companyName
param.doc: The name of the company that creates the identity provider or service provider.

param.name: identityMapping
param.doc: The identity mapping data.

param.name: pointOfContactUrl
param.doc: The endpoint URL of the point of contact server. The point of contact server is a reverse proxy server that is configured in front of the runtime listening interfaces. The format is "http[s]://hostname[:portnumber]/[junction]/sps".

param.name: providerId
param.doc: A unique identifier that identifies the provider to its partner provider. If not provided or an empty string is provided, the default value is "<point of contact URL>/<federation name>/saml11".

param.name: signatureSettings
param.doc: The signing and validation configurations for SAML messages and assertions.

param.name: attributeTypes
param.doc: Specifies the types of attributes to include in the assertion. The default, an asterisk (*), includes all the attribute types that are specified in the identity mapping file.

param.name: companyName
param.doc: The name of the company that creates the identity provider or service provider.

param.name: identityMapping
param.doc: The identity mapping data.

param.name: pointOfContactUrl
param.doc: The endpoint URL of the point of contact server. The point of contact server is a reverse proxy server that is configured in front of the runtime listening interfaces. The format is "http[s]://hostname[:portnumber]/[junction]/sps".

param.name: providerId
param.doc: A unique identifier that identifies the provider to its partner provider. If not provided or an empty string is provided, the default value is "<point of contact URL>/<federation name>/saml11".

param.name: replayValidation
param.doc: Whether to enable one-time assertion use enforcement.

param.name: signatureSettings
param.doc: The signing and validation configurations for SAML messages and assertions.

param.name: binding
param.doc: A setting that specifies the communication method used to transport the SAML messages. The valid value is "soap".

param.name: default
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether it is the default endpoint. If not provided, the default value is false.

param.name: index
param.doc: A reference to a particular endpoint. If not provided, the default value is 0.

param.name: url
param.doc: The URL of the endpoint. If not provided, the value is automatically generated from the point of contact URL.

param.name: default
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether it is the default endpoint.

param.name: index
param.doc: A reference to a particular endpoint.

param.name: url
param.doc: The URL of the endpoint.

param.name: binding
param.doc: A setting that specifies the communication method used to transport the SAML messages. The valid values are "artifact", "post", and "redirect".

param.name: default
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether it is the default endpoint. If not provided, the default value is false.

param.name: index
param.doc: A reference to a particular endpoint. If not provided, the default value is 0.

param.name: url
param.doc: The URL of the endpoint. The value is automatically generated from the point of contact URL and will not be updated by POST or PUT operation.

param.name: default
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether it is the default endpoint.

param.name: index
param.doc: A reference to a particular endpoint.

param.name: url
param.doc: The URL of the endpoint.

param.name: assertionValidBefore
param.doc: The number of seconds before the issue date that an assertion is considered valid. This configuration is applicable to an identity provider federation. The default value is 60.

param.name: assertionValidAfter
param.doc: The number of seconds the assertion is valid after being issued. This configuration is applicable to an identity provider federation. The default value is 60.

param.name: assertionAttributeTypes
param.doc: A setting that specifies the types of attributes to include in the assertion. An asterisk (*) indicates that all of the attribute types that are specified in the identity mapping file or by the custom mapping module will be included in the assertion. The default value is ["*"]. This configuration is applicable to an identity provider federation partner.

param.name: sessionNotOnOrAfter
param.doc: The number of seconds that the security context established for the principal should be discarded by the service provider. The default value is 3600. This configuration is applicable to an identity provider federation partner.

param.name: createMultipleAttributeStatements
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to keep multiple attribute statements in the groups in which they were received. This option might be necessary if your custom identity mapping rules are written to operate on one or more specific groups of attribute statements. If it is set to true, attribute statements are kept in groups (AdditionalAttributeStatement) in which they were received in the STSUniversalUser document. If it is set to false, multiple attribute statements are arranged into a single group (AttributeList) in the STSUniversalUser document. If not provided, the default value is false. This configuration is applicable to a service provider federation partner.

param.name: map
param.doc: List of configured attribute sources.

param.name: map
param.doc: List of configured attribute sources.

param.name: decryptionKeyIdentifier
param.doc: A public/private key pair that the federation partners can use to encrypt certain message content. The default value is null.

param.name: blockEncryptionAlgorithm
param.doc: Block encryption algorithm used to encrypt and decrypt SAML message. Valid values are "AES-128", "AES-192", "AES-256", and "TRIPLEDES". If not provided, the default value is "AES-128".

param.name: encryptionKeyTransportAlgorithm
param.doc: Key transport algorithm used to encrypt and decrypt keys. Valid values are "RSA-v1.5" and "RSA-OAEP". If not provided, the default value is "RSA-OAEP".

param.name: encryptionKeyIdentifier
param.doc: The certificate for encryption of outgoing SAML messages. If not provided, the default value is null.

param.name: encryptionOptions
param.doc: The encryption options.

param.name: activeDelegateId
param.doc: The active mapping module instance. Valid values are "skip-identity-map", "default-map" and "default-http-custom-map".

param.name: properties
param.doc: The mapping module specific properties.

param.name: properties
param.doc: The mapping module specific properties.

param.name: activeDelegateId
param.doc: The active mapping module instance. Valid values are "skip-extension-map" and "default-map". If this is a partner the value "federation-config" is also valid.

param.name: properties
param.doc: The mapping module specific properties.

param.name: properties
param.doc: The mapping module specific properties.

param.name: binding
param.doc: A setting that specifies the communication method used to transport the SAML messages. The valid values are "artifact", "post", "redirect" and "soap".

param.name: url
param.doc: The URL of the endpoint. Except for "soap" binding, the value is automatically generated from the point of contact URL and will not be updated by POST or PUT operation. For "soap" binding, if not provided, the value is automatically generated from the point of contact URL.

param.name: url
param.doc: The URL of the endpoint.

param.name: default
param.doc: The name identifier format to use when the format attribute is not set, or is set to "urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:unspecified". If not provided, the default value is "urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:nameid-format:persistent".

param.name: supported
param.doc: The list of supported name identifier formats. The default value is ["urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:nameid-format:persistent","urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:emailAddress","urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:nameid-format:transient","urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:unspecified"]

param.name: default
param.doc: The name identifier format to use when the format attribute is not set, or is set to "urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:unspecified". If provided, it takes precedence over the value that is configured for this partner's federation. If not provided, the value that is configured for this partner's federation is used.

param.name: keyInfoElements
param.doc: The KeyInfo elements to include in the digital signature.

param.name: signingKeyIdentifier
param.doc: A public/private key pair for signing the SAML messages and the assertion. If not provided, the default value is null.

param.name: signingOptions
param.doc: The signing options.

param.name: transformAlgorithmElements
param.doc: The Transform Algorithm elements to include in the digital signature.

param.name: validationOptions
param.doc: The validation options.

param.name: signatureAlgorithm
param.doc: The signature algorithm to sign and validate SAML messages and assertions. Valid values are "RSA-SHA1", "RSA-SHA256", and "RSA-SHA512". If not provided, the default value is "RSA-SHA256".

param.name: digestAlgorithm
param.doc: The hash algorithm to apply to the transformed resources and validate its integrity. Valid values are "SHA1", "SHA256" and "SHA512". If not provided, the default value matches the configured signature algorithm - "SHA1" for "RSA-SHA1", "SHA256" for "RSA-SHA256", and "SHA512" for "RSA-SHA512".

param.name: validationKeyIdentifier
param.doc: The certificate to use to validate the signatures on the incoming SAML assertions and messages. The default value is null.

param.name: validationOptions
param.doc: The validation options.

param.name: serverCertValidation
param.doc: The server certificate validation data.

param.name: clientAuth
param.doc: The client authentication data.

param.name: binding
param.doc: A setting that specifies the communication method used to transport the SAML messages. The valid values are "artifact", "post" and "redirect".

param.name: url
param.doc: The URL of the endpoint. The value is automatically generated from the point of contact URL and will not be updated by POST or PUT operation.

param.name: url
param.doc: The URL of the endpoint.

param.name: activeDelegateId
param.doc: The active module instance. Valid values are "noMetadata" and "metadataEndpointUrl".

param.name: properties
param.doc: The basic configuration module specific properties.

param.name: properties
param.doc: The basic configuration module specific properties.

param.name: activeDelegateId
param.doc: The active module instance. Valid values are "skip-advance-map" and "default-map".

param.name: properties
param.doc: The advance configuration module specific properties.

param.name: properties
param.doc: The advance configuration module specific properties.

param.name: keystore
param.doc: The certificate database name.

param.name: label
param.doc: The signer certificate label.

param.name: keystore
param.doc: The certificate database name.

param.name: label
param.doc: The signer certificate label.

param.name: url
param.doc: The URL of the endpoint.

param.name: keyInfoElements
param.doc: The KeyInfo elements to include in the digital signature.

param.name: signingKeyIdentifier
param.doc: A public/private key pair for signing the SAML messages and the assertion. Required if signArtifactResponse is true.

param.name: signingOptions
param.doc: The signing options.

param.name: keyInfoElements
param.doc: The KeyInfo elements to include in the digital signature.

param.name: signingKeyIdentifier
param.doc: A public/private key pair for signing the SAML messages and the assertion. Required if signArtifactResponse is true.

param.name: signingOptions
param.doc: The signing options.

param.name: aliasServiceDBType
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether the user's alias is store in jdbc or ldap.

param.name: aliasServiceLDAPConnection
param.doc: A setting that specifies the LDAP Connection to store the alias.

param.name: aliasServiceLDAPBaseDN
param.doc: A setting that specifies the LDAP BaseDN to search for the user.

param.name: validationKeyIdentifier
param.doc: The certificate to use to validate the signatures on the incoming SAML assertions and messages. Required if validateArtifactResponse is true.

param.name: validationOptions
param.doc: The validation options.

param.name: verificationKey
param.doc: The verification configuration.

param.name: name
param.doc: Name of the source.

param.name: source
param.doc: Attribute Source ID.

param.name: source
param.doc: Attribute Source ID.

param.name: keystore
param.doc: The certificate database name.

param.name: label
param.doc: The personal certificate label.

param.name: encryptNameId
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether the name identifiers should be encrypted.

param.name: encryptAssertion
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to encrypt assertions.

param.name: encryptAssertionAttributes
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to encrypt assertion attributes.

param.name: ruleType
param.doc: The type of the mapping rule. The only supported type currently is JAVASCRIPT. The value is automatically hard-coded to JAVASCRIPT and will not be updated by POST or PUT operation.

param.name: identityMappingRuleReference
param.doc: A reference to an ID of an identity mapping rule.

param.name: identityMappingRuleReference
param.doc: A reference to an ID of an identity mapping rule.

param.name: appliesTo
param.doc: Refers to STS chain that consumes callout response. Required if WSTRUST messageFormat is specified, invalid otherwise.

param.name: authType
param.doc: Authentication method used when contacting external service. Supported values are NONE, BASIC or CERTIFICATE.

param.name: basicAuthUsername
param.doc: Username for authentication to external service. Required if BASIC authType is specified, invalid otherwise.

param.name: basicAuthPassword
param.doc: Password for authentication to external service. Required if BASIC authType is specified, invalid otherwise.

param.name: clientKeyStore
param.doc: Contains key for HTTPS client authentication. Required if CERTIFICATE authType is specified, invalid otherwise.

param.name: clientKeyAlias
param.doc: Alias of the key for HTTPS client authentication. Required if CERTIFICATE authType is specified, invalid otherwise.

param.name: issuerUri
param.doc: Refers to STS chain that provides input for callout request. Required if WSTRUST messageFormat is specified, invalid otherwise.

param.name: messageFormat
param.doc: Message format of callout request. Supported values are XML or WSTRUST.

param.name: sslKeyStore
param.doc: SSL certificate trust store to use when validating SSL certificate of external service.

param.name: uri
param.doc: Address of destination server to call out to.

param.name: uri
param.doc: Address of destination server to call out to.

param.name: extensionMappingRuleReference
param.doc: A reference to an ID of an extension mapping rule.

param.name: extensionMappingRuleReference
param.doc: A reference to an ID of an extension mapping rule.

param.name: includePublicKey
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to include the public key in the KeyInfo element in the digital signature when signing a SAML message or assertion. The default value is false.

param.name: includeX509CertificateData
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to include the base 64 encoded certificate data to be included in the KeyInfo element in the digital signature when signing a SAML message or assertion. The default value is true.

param.name: includeX509IssuerDetails
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to include the issuer name and the certificate serial number in the KeyInfo element in the digital signature when signing a SAML message or assertion. The default value is false.

param.name: includeX509SubjectKeyIdentifier
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to include the X.509 subject key identifier in the KeyInfo element in the digital signature when signing a SAML message or assertion. The default value is false.

param.name: includeX509SubjectName
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to include the subject name in the KeyInfo element in the digital signature when signing a SAML message or assertion. The default value is false.

param.name: includeX509SubjectName
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to include the subject name in the KeyInfo element in the digital signature when signing a SAML message or assertion. The default value is false.

param.name: signArtifactRequest
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to sign the artifact request. The default value is false.

param.name: signArtifactResponse
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to sign the artifact response. The default value is false.

param.name: signAssertion
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to sign the assertion. The default value is false.

param.name: signAuthnResponse
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to sign the authentication responses. The default value is false.

param.name: signLogoutRequest
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to sign the logout request. The default value is false.

param.name: signLogoutResponse
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to sign the logout response. The default value is false.

param.name: signNameIDManagementRequest
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to sign the name ID management request. The default value is false.

param.name: signNameIDManagementResponse
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to sign the name ID management response. The default value is false.

param.name: includeInclusiveNamespaces
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to include the InclusiveNamespaces element in the digital signature. If not provided, the default value is true.

param.name: includeInclusiveNamespaces
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to include the InclusiveNamespaces element in the digital signature. If provided, it takes precedence over the value that is configured for this partner's federation. If not provided, the value that is configured for this partner's federation is used.

param.name: validateAssertion
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to validate the digital signature of an assertion. The default value is false.

param.name: validateAuthnRequest
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to validate the digital signature of an authentication request. The default value is false.

param.name: validateAuthnRequest
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to validate the digital signature of an authentication request. The default value is false.

param.name: validateArtifactRequest
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to validate the digital signature of an artifact request.

param.name: validateArtifactResponse
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to validate the digital signature of an artifact response.

param.name: validateLogoutRequest
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to validate the digital signature of a logout request.

param.name: validateLogoutResponse
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to validate the digital signature of a logout response.

param.name: validateNameIDManagementRequest
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to validate the digital signature of a name ID management request.

param.name: validateNameIDManagementResponse
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to validate the digital signature of a name ID management response.

param.name: keystore
param.doc: The certificate database name.

param.name: label
param.doc: The signer certificate label. If not provided, all certificates in the specified certificate database will be trusted.

param.name: method
param.doc: The authentication method. To enable the basic authentication method, enter "ba". To enable the client certificate authentication, enter "cert". To disable client authentication, enter "none".

param.name: properties
param.doc: The client authentication data. Required if the method is "ba" or "cert".

param.name: issuerIdentifier
param.doc: The issuer ("iss") value of the provider.

param.name: responseTypes
param.doc: List of response type which determines which flow to be executed. Valid values to be included are "code", "token", "id_token".

param.name: authorizationEndpointUrl
param.doc: The /authorize endpoint URL of the provider.

param.name: tokenEndpointUrl
param.doc: The /token endpoint URL of the provider. Required if "code" response type is selected.

param.name: userinfoEndpointUrl
param.doc: The /userinfo endpoint URL of the provider.

param.name: userinfoEndpointUrl
param.doc: The /userinfo endpoint URL of the provider.

param.name: metadataEndpointUrl
param.doc: The /metadata endpoint URL of the provider.

param.name: metadataEndpointUrl
param.doc: The /metadata endpoint URL of the provider.

param.name: ruleType
param.doc: The type of the mapping rule. The only supported type currently is JAVASCRIPT. The value is automatically hard-coded to JAVASCRIPT and will not be updated by POST or PUT operation.

param.name: advanceMappingRuleReference
param.doc: A reference to an ID of an advance configuration.

param.name: advanceMappingRuleReference
param.doc: A reference to an ID of an advance configuration.

param.name: signArtifactResponse
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to sign the artifact response. The default value is false.

param.name: signArtifactRequest
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to sign the artifact request. The default value is false.

param.name: validateArtifactResponse
param.doc: A setting that specifies whether to validate the signatures on the artifact response. The default value is false.

param.name: verifySignatures
param.doc: Whether to enable signature validation. The default value is false.

param.name: keyAlias
param.doc: The keystore and certificate to use to validate the signature. Only required if verifySignatures is set to true and useKeyInfo is set to false.

param.name: keyInfo
param.doc: The regular expression used to find the X509 certificate for signature validation. Only required if verifySignatures is set to true and useKeyInfo is set to true.

param.name: useKeyInfo
param.doc: Whether to use the keyInfo of the XML signature to find the X509 certificate for signature validation (true) or the specified keyAlias (false). Only required if verifySignatures is set to true.

param.name: username
param.doc: The basic authentication username.

param.name: password
param.doc: The basic authentication password.

param.name: keystore
param.doc: The certificate database name.

param.name: label
param.doc: The personal certificate label.

response.doc: Created. A new resource was created. The request was successful.

param.name: Location: https://{appliance_hostname}/iam/access/v8/federations/{federation-id}/partners/{partner-id}
param.doc: URI to the newly created object.

response.doc: Bad Request. There is a problem with the request. The JSON result describes the problem.

param.name: Content-Type:application/json
param.doc: Response is in JSON formatting.

param.name: result
param.doc: The error message.

response.doc: Not Found. The requested service does not exist. The JSON message indicates which resource.

param.name: Content-Type:application/json
param.doc: Response is in JSON formatting.

param.name: result
param.doc: The error message.

response.doc: Conflict. The JSON result indicates the problem.

param.name: Content-Type:application/json
param.doc: Response is in JSON formatting.

param.name: result
param.doc: The error message.

response.doc: An internal error occurred. The JSON message indicates the problem.

param.name: Content-Type:application/json
param.doc: Response is in JSON formatting.

param.name: result
param.doc: The error message.
